title: Fix site-wide unclickable UI (clicks not responding)

requirements.text: Investigate and fix the issue where the published portfolio site UI does not respond to clicks (buttons, links, portfolio items, and form inputs). Identify any global overlay elements, stacking-context/z-index issues, or CSS/pointer-events rules that are preventing pointer events from reaching interactive elements.

quotes: it is not responsing to any click

acceptanceCriteria: On the published site, clicking the HERO CTA buttons triggers their intended actions (scroll to #portfolio and scroll to #contact).
In PORTFOLIO, clicking a project card opens the project modal; clicking the backdrop or the close button closes it.
In CONTACT, input fields can be focused and typed into; the WhatsApp Direct button and social links are clickable.
No full-screen decorative layer (background gradients, starfield canvas, hero background images/grids, scanline effects, etc.) blocks pointer events over the main content.

requirements.text: Ensure all purely decorative, full-screen/absolute/fixed visual layers do not capture pointer events (e.g., background canvases, fixed grid overlays, hero background image layers), while keeping interactive content layers clickable and visually unchanged.

quotes: it is not responsing to any click

acceptanceCriteria: Decorative layers render normally but have no impact on clicking/scrolling/hovering interactive UI.
Interactive components remain above decorative layers in stacking order and reliably receive click events across sections.

requirements.text: Add a minimal in-app debug aid for this specific issue: when running in development mode, provide an easy way to verify click handling is working (e.g., a small temporary click test element or console logging gated to development only) and remove/disable it for production builds.

quotes: it is not responsing to any click

acceptanceCriteria: In development, it is straightforward to verify click handling without inspecting multiple components manually.
Production build contains no visible debug UI and does not log noisy click-debug output.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: Implementing a CMS/editor for the live site.
Changing the visual theme or redesigning sections beyond what is required to restore click interactivity.
